website_summaries.verdict: Climbers who wish to boost their performance while bouldering might want to give the Butora Acro a try. Indeed, this superbly comfortable climbing shoe is well equipped for such a pursuit. That said, this amazingly grippy footgear also excels in both heel- and toe-hooking scenarios.The only thing that gives this purchase-worthy product a bad name, however, is its allegedly too-spacious heel region. Nonetheless, the Acro is yet another Butora masterpiece whose strengths far outweigh a couple of missteps.
pros: The Butora Acro blue and orange (narrow and wide variants, respectively) are extremely comfortable, as mentioned by almost every buyer
Many of those who have put the shoe through the wringer say that its outsole is remarkably sticky
Its hooking abilities (whether heel or toe) are nothing short of spectacular, according to several reviewers
A good number of people who have purchased this Butora rock climbing footgear swear by the shoe’s exemplary bouldering prowess
Some owners who have bought the Acro find it a nice piece of investment
This Butora offering does well on overhangs, based on a couple of reports
cons: Several wearers claim that the heel zone of this product is too roomy
Less than a handful of shoppers complain about the Acro’s rubber wearing out in just a few months
Its sensitivity could be a bit better, claims a moderately experienced sender

customer_reviews.title: Not good for wide feet at all
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and having a hard time finding a climbing shoe that fits wide feet but this shoe is a horrible choice. It is narrower than my Scarpa Vapor V and Scarpa Force V and horribly uncomfortable. 99% of the shoe is hard rubber including the heel cup it's like putting your foot inside of a tire comfort wise. The heel digs into the Achilles area because the rubber is so hard. I was only able to wear the shoe for about 10 seconds and couldn't even stand up in them they were so uncomfortable. If you are looking for a wide climbing shoe or one that is reasonably comfortable keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: This shoe is not only the most comfortable aggressive climbing shoe I've worn but the most comfortable ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This shoe is not only the most comfortable aggressive climbing shoe I've worn but the most comfortable climbing shoe, PERIOD. The wide version is AMAZING for my wide but low volume feet. The liner is super comfortable and even with curled toes I haven't had the irritation problems most other climbing shoes give me. The shoe locks into place and has a great combination of stiffness and sensitivity for both bouldering and sport use. Very comparable to a Sportiva Katana, another great all around shoe, but far more comfortable and a MUCH better fit for wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes I ever had for ovehangs & bouldering.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing. From a performance point of view, these are great. Espcially for overhangs and bouldering. For routes that require edging on small holds I still prefer my Miuras. Their huge benefit though, is that they are one of the only shoes In the market that offer a narrow fit. I am sized 42 with running shoes and with La Sportiva Solution I used to go down to size 38, which is insanely painful. With these however, I can go with 41.5. La Sportiva shoes, while great, fit better for wider feet (even their women models).
customer_reviews.author: Elad Maimoni

customer_reviews.title: Might have to go a size or at least half a size higher
customer_reviews.text: I really am enjoying this product. And this is a real buyer lol. I had to return the earlier shipment of this product because it ended up being a size too small. And was unbareable on my feet so I went a whole size bigger, to a 11 1/2. It was rough at first but now my foot is almost well adapted to it. It has a cool look to it and it did the job on this last outdoor rock climbing hike I did. Definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Really nice construction and fit. I'm a US 10-10.5 street size and I ended up with an 11 that is a tight fit for bouldering.
customer_reviews.author: M C Arnold

customer_reviews.title: My favorite bouldering shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are perfect for more advanced indoor bouldering. Tight narrow fit. Im size 9 street and size 9.5 in my Butora's ( tight fit ).
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good aggressive stiff shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great if your looking for an aggressive, stiff soled 'talon' style shoe- similar to the La Sportiva Solutions. I like these types of shoes VERY tight on my foot and I ended up going down 2 full sizes from my street shoe to get the fit I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Myles Alexander Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Normally wear a 10 maybe 10.5. Got an 11 and painfully tight. Hoping they will break in...
customer_reviews.author: chriss

customer_reviews.title: Tight heel and toes
customer_reviews.text: The heel is very pinchy as well as the toes, more so than a normal climbing shoe. With larger sizes I go up a full size over my street shoe, with this one I feel like I should have gotten a 14.5 rather than the 14.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wimmer

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy as I don't have to return them for another ...
customer_reviews.text: I just got my Butoras size 10.5 tonight & they fit similar to my Evolv Rastas Shamans size 10.5. I'm happy as I don't have to return them for another size!!! As for the shoe they feel good and most likely fit better in time. I can't wait to try them out at my local gym TRG. I'll update my review later. But if your looking to buy I can only comment and compare theses Butoras to my Evolv Rastas. Update 2-21-17 so far these shoes are comparable to my Evolvs as far as performance but are not as wide as the Evolvs so they feel a little tight, I'll keep wearing them to break them in more.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dural

customer_reviews.title: On time
customer_reviews.text: Great fit simple and easy design few minor scuffs upon arrival but they’re rock climbing shoes common
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Best Climbing Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Best Climbing Shoe Ever. Better than Solutions for less cost and are also more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Holsopple

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase. Fit like a glove and are easy to take off as well
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Silva

customer_reviews.title: I had to return these shoes because they did not ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these shoes because they did not fit my feet well, but I would definitely suggest other people try them out.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Yang

customer_reviews.title: Great edging, surprisingly comfortable fit in an aggressive shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my 5th pair of shoes over a couple of years of climbing. I've just tried different brands and styles to find what I like. These are the best. I'll buy another pair, or have them resoled.
customer_reviews.author: SDD

customer_reviews.title: Great toe box sloppy heal
customer_reviews.text: Best toe box in the market... sloppy heel. Every person I’ve talked to complains about the heal. Wish they would figure this out!
customer_reviews.author: Chloe Mielke

product_meta.title: Butora Acro Climbing Shoes Orange/White 2020 Sport Shoes
product_meta.description: ACRO is the best option to avoid having to choose between comfort and performance. The sole is curved, designed for sport climbing and bouldering. The heel offers sensitivity and preciseness, and its design gives strength to the toe. The instep made of NEO FUSE rubber ensures a safe grip in the most technical steps. Thanks to the combination of synthetic and natural leather, the shoe fits comfortably. Despite the fastening with Velcro strap, the three strips attached to it tighten as much as shoelaces. ACRO is made with the Butora's exclusive 3D-printed midsole. This model is for wide feet. Product specific size information: Normal cut Fit: Normal Weight Weight single shoe: 64 g Climbing Shoes Category: performance Applications: Bouldering Climbing Shoe Material Sole: Neo Fuse Lining: hemp Outer material: Microfibre Climbing Shoe Features Closure: Velcro fastener With adjustable straps With Toepatch Number of straps: 3 Heel construction: With heel strap Tongue: One-sided on the shaft Sole Sole stiffness: strongly Design type: Continuous Preload: strongly Type bands: Strongly asymmetric Downturn: strongly Cut Fit foot width: wide Tip of the shoe: pointed
feature_bullets: The Acro is an aggressively down-cambered shoe designed for steep sport climbing and bouldering.
The combination of soft synthetic and natural leather in the upper construction allows for even greater performance and a surprisingly comfortable fit.
The high-tensioned heel rand brings all the power to the front toe for superior edging.
Butora's signature triple fork hook and loop strap provides the convenience of a slipper with the extra security and custom fit of a lace-up shoe.
The large sticky rubber toe patch allows for secure toe hooking in even the most technical situations.
